sourceDesc.p: The contents of this document are generated from SOSOL.

revisionDesc.change: Entered text from ed. with english trans. Remaining issues: Line 7: ed. had a question mark after “name” in the lacuna: I could not figure out how to add this. // Line 8: I did not correct to "Arsinoitou" as per ed., as this gave a more than usually false impression of the lacunae in the line for little orthographic benefit.// Lines 9-10, 13-14: There were corrections and regularizations of words that crossed over lines, and I could not figure out how to manipulate the display such that it preserved regular formatting.// Line 14: corrected editorial abbreviation by removing periods in original editions for “nom.” and “ker.”.

div.p: ΧΜΓ † In the name of the lord and master Jesus Christ, our god and saviour. Mesore 15 of the 12th indiction. (From) Aurelios Georgios, son of abba Apanagios, monk in the monasterion of the Tower and its anchorite, through my brother, son of the same Apanagios, father, [ name ] from the village of Eleusina of the Arsinoite nome to the most pious abba Menas from the Monastery of Kothau on the Mountain of the Cells, greeting. I acknowledge that I have received from you (singular), from [your] hand [to my hands], for my private and necessary use, one gold solidus less seven carats and a half and a fourth, that is 1 sol. less 7 1/2 1/4 car., as capital, and I will repay you on Mecheir 15 [of the coming thirteenth indiction], without delay. [You shall have the right of execution] from my whole estate and when asked the formal question I so declared. † † Through me, Ioannes, presbyter [?]
† (From) Aurelios Georgios, son of abba Apanagios, monk [?] to abba Menas [?].
